channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter/Cig Butts/Health Issue, 15th June
item.description:
Really don't wanna be a pain but this is the other long standing issue outside Sainsbury's. I'm not really sure what this is supposed to be for (air for bike tyres?) but as you can see its abused on a daily basis, well it always looks like this. I'm not even sure if this even works anymore, it looks a in bad way. This is right outside the betting shop (another litter issue for the planters and plant pots). Does this ashtray need to be here anymore? Its pretty unsightly and disgusting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Prickly shrub outside 86 Woodside Avenue, 15th June
item.description:
Please trim back this shrub and clear away the cuttings, it has huge thorns on it and overhangs the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodside Avenue, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Verges need finishing, 15th June
item.description:
Woodside Avenue looks a mess, the verges were finally cut and there's long grass just left along all the gutter and around the trees. Surely some one could carefully strim around the trees and sweep along the road. It's like the job is half done. The verges are growing over the footpath. It's all very well to have 'No Mow May' but then there's a mess afterwards.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodside Avenue, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The grass in the picnic area is really long and needs cutting, 15th June
item.description:
The grass in the picnic area at Jubilee Country Park hasn't been cut for many weeks. It is now really long. This could be dangerous for small children as if there was any broken glass etc. amongst it they would not be able to see it. As a member of the Friends of Jubilee Country Park I have had a number of complaints about this from the public.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merton Gardens, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Issue, 15th June
item.description:
Same area, outside Sainsbury's. The new issue now is the constant dumping of multiple black bins by one of the flats just outside the entrance. The bags in the picture aren't too bad because I cleaned them up prior (picture taken very early am). Can you provide a wheelie bin for these flats to stop this? Obviously the issue here is foxes tearing these bags open adding to the mess and the ongoing rodent issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Issue!, 15th June
item.description:
I know I have reported this before but unfortunately nothing seems to be happening and the litter (health) issue remains (as do the rodents). This area outside Sainsbury's is quite frankly, disgusting. It REALLY NEEDS to be kept clean on a regular basis because apparently people can't stop littering around here (and going to the toilet judging by the smell).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Suitcase dumped on council land. Still there. Report falsely fixed., 15th June
item.description:
Photo taken 15th June 2025, it’s still there. Previous report was marked as “fixed” when it’s not been cleared.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Genesta Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A mattress has been left in front of my house entrance., 15th June
item.description:
A mattress has been left in front of my house entrance. Unfortunately, this has become a recurring problem in our area, and it appears that no concrete action is being taken to address it. Many residents now seem to view this kind of illegal dumping as normal, which is deeply concerning. I urge the appropriate authorities or community leaders to take this matter seriously and implement measures to prevent further occurrences. Maintaining the cleanliness and safety of our neighborhood should be a shared responsibility.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woburn Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public Litter Bins, 15th June
item.description:
I realise this might not seem important but the public litter bins in this recreation ground (and others) have these quite ridiculous wide open bins that are essentially open picnic baskets for foxes to dig up. On top of that, if the wind should get up then the litter is easily blown out of these bins. Can these bins not be replaced with the square bins you on Beckenham Green? Or those plastic circular ones on the street? Surely you can see the problem here? (and I'm sure you all know the litter issue is a constant battle as it is).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Litter, 15th June
item.description:
I have noticed these car parking bays seem to attract A LOT of litter on a regular basis. So I was wondering if they are really required? If people are just going to litter (to the extreme) in all these bays then can we just get rid of them and double yellow that side? I don't really see why there are parking bays there in the first place.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 15th June
item.description:
Wood and garden waste dumped at the side of West Heath Road. Behind this patch of dumped rubbish are about 5 business sign boards for a paving company that I have previously reported but ‘couldn’t be found’! Still there, with a business phone number on them!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Heath Road, Abbey Wood, London
